alert.note: Alert for Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 9:40AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pickens County through 1030 AM CDT... At 940 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ethelsville, or 9 miles southeast of Columbus, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reform, Carrollton, Ethelsville, Owens, North Pickens Airport, McShan and Macedonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
